name: Introduction to Engineering
description: This course introduces students to the engineering field, covering basic engineering principles, design, and software tools.

name: Calculus I
description: This course covers the basics of calculus, including limits, derivatives, and integrals.

name: Calculus II
description: This course covers more advanced topics in calculus, including multivariable calculus, series, and differential equations.

name: Differential Equations
description: This course covers more advanced topics in differential equations, including Laplace transforms, Fourier series, and partial differential equations.

name: Mechanics and Dynamics I
description: This course covers the basics of mechanics and dynamics, including kinematics, Newton's laws, work, energy, and momentum.

name: Mechanics and Dynamics II
description: This course covers more advanced topics in mechanics and dynamics, including rigid body motion, Lagrangian mechanics, and Hamiltonian mechanics.

name: Thermodynamics
description: This course covers the basics of thermodynamics, including properties of fluids, thermodynamic systems, and the laws of thermodynamics.

name: Fluid Mechanics
description: This course covers the basics of fluid mechanics, including the Navier-Stokes equation, Bernoulli's equation, and laminar and turbulent flow.
